page.title: 06THE VILLAGE HALL, PADBURY
page.content: When a new school was built in Padbury the old school was bought by the village to be used as a Village Hall. The Hall is used by many village organisations;the Playgroup, Christian Fellowship, Women's Institute, Mothers Union, Friendly Afternoon, Dancing and Keep Fit Classes and Whist Drives. It is also used for monthly meetings and for A.G.M.s by several groups. It is also let for private parties, dances, wedding receptions etc. It is run by a committee with representatives of village organisations. Money from hiring charges and fund raising efforts keep the hall going. At the present time money is being raised for a lot of maintenance work and proposed alterations. Recently a new toilet block has been built and a damp-proof course installed. It is truly the centre of village life.
